newsitem.title: USA: Colt's Mfg won't cut Conn. jobs - report.
newsitem.headline: Colt's Mfg won't cut Conn. jobs - report.

text.p: Colt's Manufacturing Co will not cut any jobs in Connecticut as a result of its pending purchase of Belgian gunmaker FN Herstal, the Hartford Courant reported on Wednesday.
Colt's Chief Executive Ronald Stewart told the newspaper in an interview that the company has not decided exactly how to combine the two companies.

Stewart said the company would stay in West Hartford for at least six or seven years. He said there could be layoffs if sales fall off, but added that employment has been stable at about 730 workers for the past year.
Colt's announced last week that it had reached a preliminary agreement to buy French-controlled Giat Industries' share of FN, formerly Fabrique Nationale.
Colt's and Giat are privately owned and the terms of the deal were not disclosed.
Stewart said company officials initially wanted to buy only FN's Winchester and U.S. military businesses, thinking they would expand and complement Colt's line of guns.
But Giat, which owns 92 percent of FN, insisted that the operation not be broken up. Colt's decided it was worth pursuing and may make other acquisitions, Stewart said.
"The industry is ripe for a consolidation," he said. "You've really got two choices. You're either a consolidator or you get consolidated."
